abstract: The revised estimate came as the Japanese automaker posted a 1.1 billion yen net profit for the April-June quarter, a tiny fraction of the 190.4 billion yen it earned a year earlier.
snippet: The revised estimate came as the Japanese automaker posted a 1.1 billion yen net profit for the April-June quarter, a tiny fraction of the 190.4 billion yen it earned a year earlier.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Citing a quicker than expected recovery from Japan’s earthquake, the Toyota Motor Corporation raised its full-year profit forecast by almost 40 percent Tuesday, although it warned that a strong yen continued to weigh on its bottom line.

headline.main: Toyota, Rebounding From Quake, Raises Profit Forecast
headline.print_headline: Toyota, Rebounding From Quake, Sees Rosier Future

abstract: Honda and Toyota posted sharp decreases, while General Motors, Ford and Chrysler reported increases.
snippet: Honda and Toyota posted sharp decreases, while General Motors, Ford and Chrysler reported increases.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Sales of new vehicles in the United States rose in July but were still hampered by economic concerns and low inventories of many Japanese models.

headline.main: Despite Rising U.S. Sales, Automakers Are Struggling
headline.print_headline: Despite Rising U.S. Sales, Automakers Are Struggling
